clinical_study.brief_title: Intrathecal Rituximab in Progressive Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Intrathecal Rituximab in Progressive Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of investigators is to study the kinetics of action of a single dose of intrathecally-infused rituximab upon cerebro-spinal fluid (CSF) biological targets in progressive MS patients. Various markers of central nervous system inflammation (osteopontin, Tumor Necrosis Factor α, IgG secretion) and neurodegeneration (neurofilament) are studied at multiple time-points, assuming that a definitive action upon CSF biological targets would be strongly predictive of a delayed clinical action.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in osteopontin level in CSF

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Tumor Necrosis Factor alpha level in CSF
Change in IgG synthesis in CSF
Change in neurofilament level in CSF

other_outcome.description: Subjective appreciation and multiple clinical scales (walking time, nine hole peg test, EDSS, SDMT, Fatigue Intensity Scale)
Percent change in total brain volume (SIENA)

arm_group.description: receive a single pulse of methylprednisolone IV (120mg)
receive a single intrathecal infusion of rituximab (with IV methylprednisolone 120mg to avoid side effect)
receive Rituximab IT as previous and Rituximab IV (375mg/m2) the same day
